Views

collection.views.add_card_to_collection(request, id)[source]

Adds a selected card to the authenticated user’s collection.

Parameters: - request: The HTTP request object - id: The ID of the card to add to the collection

Returns: JsonResponse indicating the success or failure of the operation.

collection.views.cards_view(request, set_id=None)[source]

Renders a view that displays cards based on the selected set.

Parameters: - request: The HTTP request object - set_id: The ID of the set to filter cards by (optional)

Returns: Rendered HTML page with data on cards.

collection.views.collection_view(request)[source]

Renders a view that displays recent sets from the Set model in the database.

Parameters: - request: The HTTP request object

Returns: Rendered HTML page with data on recent sets.

collection.views.my_collection(request)[source]

Renders a view showing all the cards in the authenticated user’s collection.

Parameters: - request: The HTTP request object

Returns: Rendered HTML page with data on the user’s collection.

collection.views.populate_cards_to_database()[source]

Populate the Card model in the database using data fetched from an API.

Parameters: None

Returns: None

collection.views.populate_data(request)[source]

Wrapper function to populate both sets and cards into the database.

Parameters: - request: The HTTP request object

Returns: HttpResponse indicating the success or failure of the operation.

collection.views.populate_sets_to_database()[source]

Populate the Set model in the database using data fetched from an API.

Parameters: None

Returns: None

collection.views.remove_card_from_collection(request, id)[source]

Removes a selected card from the authenticated user’s collection.

Parameters: - request: The HTTP request object - id: The ID of the card to remove from the collection

Returns: JsonResponse indicating the success or failure of the operation.
